Simple Qubit.¶

When a qubit is created, it starts at \(|0>\) state. However, all 6 cardinal states on the block sphere are tracked.

SfqQubit¶

class sfqQubit.SfqQubit(d_theta=0.015707963267948967, w_clock=31415926535.89793, w_qubit=(31415926535.89793, 61575216010.35995), theta=1.5707963267948966)[source]¶

Qubit controlled by SFQ pulses. This class is to be subclassed.

__init__(d_theta=0.015707963267948967, w_clock=31415926535.89793, w_qubit=(31415926535.89793, 61575216010.35995), theta=1.5707963267948966)[source]¶

Create a qubit controlled by SFQ pulses.

Parameters:
  • d_theta – Angle of single y-rotation.
  • w_clock – Clock angular frequency
  • w_qubit – (Qubit angular frequency, Leakage level angular frequency)
  • theta – Total rotation.
kets¶

The 6 cardinal rotated states.

Returns:The 6 cardinal rotated states.
measure_fidelity()[source]¶

Measure the fidelity. Implement in subclasses.

precess()[source]¶

Precess the qubit for one clock period.

pulse_and_precess()[source]¶

Rotate the qubit for d_theta around y-axes, then precess for one clock period.

pulse_pattern(pattern)[source]¶

Evolve the qubit according to a sequence of 0 (precession) and 1 (sfq pulse_and_precess).

Parameters:pattern – The pulse sequence.
resonance()[source]¶

Apply a resonance pulse sequence to the qubit.

Sfq3LevelQubit¶

class sfqQubit.Sfq3LevelQubit(d_theta=0.015707963267948967, w_clock=31415926535.89793, w_qubit=(31415926535.89793, 61575216010.35995), theta=1.5707963267948966)[source]¶

Qubit with one leakage level.

measure_fidelity(method='states', ignore_leakage=False)[source]¶

Measure the fidelity of the rotation applied to the qubit.

Parameters:
  • method – Either ‘states’ or ‘gates’.
  • ignore_leakage – Do not account for the leakage level when computing fidelity.
Returns:

The fidelity.

If ‘states’ is provided,

\[F_{avg} = \frac{1}{6} \sum_{\alpha} Tr\{U_G\rho_{\alpha}U^{\dagger}_G U_{id}\rho_{\alpha}U_{id}^{\dagger}\}\]

Where :math: alpha = pm x, pm y, pm z.

If ‘gates’ is provided,

\[F_{avg} = \frac{1}{6} \left( Tr\{U^{\dagger}_G \mathcal{P} U_G \mathcal{P} \} + | Tr\{\mathcal{P} U_{id}^{\dagger} U_G\}|^2 \right)\]

Where \(U_{id}\) is the ideal gate, and :math: mathcal{P} is the projection onto qubit subspace.

kets¶

The 6 cardinal rotated states.

Returns:The 6 cardinal rotated states.
precess()¶

Precess the qubit for one clock period.

pulse_and_precess()¶

Rotate the qubit for d_theta around y-axes, then precess for one clock period.

pulse_pattern(pattern)¶

Evolve the qubit according to a sequence of 0 (precession) and 1 (sfq pulse_and_precess).

Parameters:pattern – The pulse sequence.
resonance()¶

Apply a resonance pulse sequence to the qubit.

Sfq2LevelQubit¶

class sfqQubit.Sfq2LevelQubit(d_theta=0.015707963267948967, w_clock=31415926535.89793, w_qubit=(31415926535.89793, 61575216010.35995), theta=1.5707963267948966)[source]¶

Ideal two level qubit.

measure_fidelity(method='states')[source]¶

Measure the fidelity of the rotation applied to the qubit.

Parameters:method – Currently only states is implemented. TODO Implement ‘gates’.
Returns:The fidelity.

If ‘states’ is provided,

\[F_{avg} = \frac{1}{6} \sum_{\alpha} Tr\{U_G\rho_{\alpha}U^{\dagger}_G U_{id}\rho_{\alpha}U_{id}^{\dagger}\}\]

Where \(\alpha = \pm x, \pm y, \pm z\).

kets¶

The 6 cardinal rotated states.

Returns:The 6 cardinal rotated states.

Precess the qubit for one clock period.

pulse_and_precess()¶

Rotate the qubit for d_theta around y-axes, then precess for one clock period.

Evolve the qubit according to a sequence of 0 (precession) and 1 (sfq pulse_and_precess).

Parameters:pattern – The pulse sequence.

Apply a resonance pulse sequence to the qubit.

SfqSequence¶

class sfqQubit.SfqSequence(sequence_dec, length)[source]¶

This class represents a pulse sequence. It does decimal to binary conversion and visualization of the pulse sequence.

__init__(sequence_dec, length)[source]¶

Create a pulse sequence of length long using a decimal number> If the sequence_dec is too large to be represented by a length bits, it will be truncated.

Parameters:
  • sequence_dec – The sequence specified as an integer.
  • length – The length of the bit string.
binary¶

Binary representation of the sequence.

Returns:the sequence as a bit string.
static decimal_to_binary(digits)[source]¶

Convert a number from decimal to binary (in reversed order). e.g. 6 -> [0, 1, 1]

Parameters:
  • num – The decimal number to be converted.
  • digits – The number of binary digits allowed.
Return type:

Iterator[int]
plot_sequence(ax)[source]¶

Plot the pulse sequence as a bar code. :param ax: The axis on which the bar code will be plotted.
